ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Lambent woes....
ygData.msgSnippet: The bark shield has a high armor class also, and it provides +5 agi. Not a bad item, someone in N FP gave it to me once, bit of a weirdo, said they ll gamble a
ygData.messageBody:
The bark shield has a high armor class also, and it provides +5 agi. Not a
bad item, someone in N FP gave it to me once, bit of a weirdo, said they'll
gamble a Rubicite BP for my FBSS, so for a laugh I said ok, rolled higher
than her and she said bah, have this instead. Strange person.....





"Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> on 11/04/2000 14:55:01

Please respond to eqbards@egroups.com

To: "'eqbards@egroups.com'" <eqbards@egroups.com>
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lambent woes....




The Chitin Shell Shield, also from Upper Guk and about three rooms away
from
the Scryer, go figure, is also AC 15. Its a little heavier than the orb
and
no where near as cool looking, but functional.

Now why would they put the two such high AC shield items only 3 rooms apart
in a world this big and then nothing until dragon loot???

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 11, 2000 8:26 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lambent woes....


Huh? which item?

Runed Bone Fork is a great resist item - put it in your ranged slot for
MR+10 HR+10 CR+10 - DragonWear(tm)

Shimmering Orb is a great shield AC 15 HP+20 (weight 0.2) - next best
shield
is a Bladestopper off Nagafen. (Do you think maybe there is a slight gap in
the loot?)

Sylly

----- Original Message -----
From: "Papa Legba" <legba@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 11, 2000 9:17 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lambent woes....


> I actually find the item a total mystery. People really pay up for it
> (I was offered 350P for mine), and I have no idea who wants it...
